basics.name: Alankrit Singh
basics.summary: Computer Science undergraduate at BITS Pilani, Goa, with research interests in AI, Machine Learning, and Autonomous Systems. Currently working on autonomous driving behavior modeling and neural genomics of AI models.

work.summary: Contributed to the Intelligent Data Pipeline project for scalable GenAI-ready NLP data processing. Migrated pipeline infrastructure from Google Cloud to Azure, enabling dataset curation for LLM training.
highlights: Migrated pipeline infrastructure from Google Cloud to Azure
Enabled dataset curation for LLM training
Worked on scalable GenAI-ready NLP data processing

education.institution: Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS Pilani)
education.area: Bachelor of Engineering in Computer Science

publications.name: ADAPT: Adaptive Driver Behaviour Modelling for Autonomous Driving Systems
publications.summary: A transformer-based architecture for autonomous driving agent behavior modeling using multi-modal fusion and hierarchical attention mechanisms for explainable anomaly detection. Supervised by Prof. Snehanshu Saha and Prof. Santonu Sarkar at APPCAIR.

research.title: ADAPT: Adaptive Driver Behaviour Modelling
research.description: Proposed and leading development of an autonomous driving agent architecture using the NavSim framework. Designing a transformer-based architecture that fuses multi-modal inputs including kinematic and camera data using hierarchical attention mechanisms to detect and quantify anomalous driving in an explainable way. Creating a novel dataset to benchmark anomaly detection models in the CARLA simulator.

research.title: nDNA: A Geometric Framework for Tracing the Latent Genome of AI
research.description: Analyzing the latent geometry of AI models (LLMs, VLMs, Diffusion Models etc.) through Neural Genomics, a paradigm that treats them as semantic organisms with traceable inner cognition instead of black-box tools. Applying Neural DNA (nDNA), a novel diagnostic framework that integrates Riemannian geometry and statistical thermodynamics to quantify a model's internal belief structures and epistemic traits.

teaching.description: Designed and conducted tutorials and homework assignments on deep learning concepts for undergraduate and graduate students and evaluated student submissions.

Supporting undergraduate and graduate students in understanding cutting-edge generative AI technologies including GANs, VAEs, Diffusion Models, LLMs, and Vision-Language Models. Designing tutorials and assignments covering theoretical concepts and practical implementations.

activities.description: Co-organized the AI symposium, ensuring the seamless execution of lectures and Q&A sessions. Oversaw logistical arrangements for guest accommodations and overall event coordination.

portfolio.name: LLMExam: AI-Driven Question Paper Generation
portfolio.description: Developed a multimodal system using a local VLM (Qwen2.5-VL) to automatically extract textual questions, diagrams, and graphs from PDFs. Employed vector search for topic-based retrieval and designed an LLM-driven topic tagging mechanism for precise question classification.

portfolio.name: Zero-Shot Learning using RoBERTa
portfolio.description: Enhanced classification accuracy by iteratively optimizing label prompts using generative language models (Gemma2-9B, Qwen2.5-32B, and Nemotron-70B). Improved performance metrics, achieving a significant increase in accuracy from 48.5% to 82.13% with Nemotron-70B.

portfolio.name: MonetAI: Generating Artistic Images using GANs
portfolio.description: Developed a generative model replicating Claude Monet's artistic style using CycleGANs.
